question: What is the primary purpose of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)?

options.a: To standardise cloud computing pricing across the European Union.
options.b: To protect the personal data and privacy of EU citizens.
options.c: To enforce strict firewall configurations for US-based companies.
options.d: To regulate health insurance portability in Europe.

question: Which of the following is NOT one of the three major regulations covered in the course module?
Under GDPR, what is the maximum fine for non-compliance?

options.a: €10 million or 2% of global annual revenue
options.b: €20 million or 4% of global annual revenue
options.c: $25 million or 5% of global annual revenue

question: Within what timeframe must a company report a data breach to authorities under GDPR?
Which GDPR right allows users to ask for their data to be deleted?
What does the concept 'Data Protection by Design and Default' imply?

options.a: Security measures must be added after the system is deployed.
options.b: Security measures must be integrated into the system at the design phase.
options.c: Data should only be encrypted when a breach occurs.
options.d: Users are responsible for designing their own privacy settings.

question: To whom does HIPAA primarily apply?

options.b: Healthcare providers, insurers, and businesses handling patient data in the US.
options.c: Financial institutions handling credit card data.

question: Which HIPAA rule specifically controls who can access Personal Health Information (PHI)?
The HIPAA Security Rule requires three types of safeguards. What are they?
What is a Business Associate Agreement (BAA) in the context of HIPAA?

options.a: A contract between a hospital and a patient regarding payment.
options.b: A contract ensuring a cloud provider is compliant when handling healthcare data.
options.c: An agreement between two insurance companies to share profit.
options.d: A license required to practice medicine in the cloud.

question: What year did the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) take effect?
Which of the following is a criterion for a business to be subject to CCPA?

options.b: Processing personal info of fewer than 10,000 residents.

question: What does the 'Right to Opt Out' entitle consumers to under CCPA?

options.a: To stop using the internet entirely.
options.b: To opt out of having their data sold to third parties.
options.c: To refuse to pay for online services.
options.d: To block all advertisements on a website.

question: What is the potential fine per violation under CCPA?
Which framework is specifically designed as a cloud security certification by the Cloud Security Alliance?
ISO/IEC 27017 extends ISO 27002 to provide controls specifically for:
SOC 2 compliance is based on five Trust Service Criteria. Which is NOT one of them?
What is the primary function of a SIEM (Security Information and Event Management) solution?

options.b: To centralize and analyze security logs across an environment.
options.c: To act as a firewall for web applications.

question: Which of the following is an example of a SIEM tool?
What is the difference between Data Residency and Data Sovereignty?

options.a: Residency refers to encryption; Sovereignty refers to storage.
options.b: Residency is the physical location; Sovereignty implies the data is subject to the laws of that location.
options.c: There is no difference; they are synonyms.
options.d: Residency applies to cloud data; Sovereignty applies to on-premise data.

question: Which Chinese law mandates that sensitive data collected in China must remain in China?
The 2019 Capital One data breach was primarily caused by:

options.a: A phishing email sent to the CEO.
options.d: Lack of encryption on the database.

question: What is Data Masking?

options.a: Encoding data so it can only be read with a key.
options.b: Altering sensitive data to hide it while retaining its format for usability.
options.c: Deleting data permanently from a drive.
options.d: Backing up data to a hidden server.

question: Which type of data masking permanently alters data before it is stored?
How does Tokenization differ from Encryption?

options.a: Tokenization is reversible using a key; Encryption is not.
options.b: Tokenization replaces data with a random placeholder; Encryption uses algorithms to transform data.
options.c: Tokenization is only for healthcare data; Encryption is for financial data.
options.d: Tokenization uses more processing power than encryption.

question: Where are the original values stored in a tokenization system?
What is the goal of Data Anonymization?

options.a: To encrypt data so it can be restored later.
options.b: To remove PII so individuals cannot be identified, enabling data analysis.
options.c: To compress data for cheaper storage.
options.d: To mask data only during retrieval.

question: What is Differential Privacy?

options.a: Adding 'noise' to datasets to prevent re-identification while maintaining statistical accuracy.
options.b: Keeping data private by not sharing it with anyone.
options.c: Using different passwords for different accounts.
options.d: Encrypting data with two different keys.

question: According to the 3-2-1 Backup Rule, you should maintain:

options.a: 3 copies of data, on 2 different media, with 1 offsite.
options.b: 3 servers, 2 hard drives, and 1 cloud account.
options.c: 3 full backups, 2 differential backups, and 1 incremental backup.
options.d: 3 types of encryption, 2 firewalls, and 1 antivirus.

question: What is an Incremental Backup?

options.a: A complete copy of all data.
options.b: Stores only the changes made since the last backup.
options.c: Accumulates changes made since the last full backup.
options.d: Backs up data in real-time continuously.

question: Which of the following is considered PII (Personally Identifiable Information)?
What is the main objective of a Penetration Test?

options.b: To simulate real-world cyberattacks to identify exploitable vulnerabilities.
options.c: To configure user permissions in the cloud.
options.d: To audit the financial records of a company.

question: What does the 'Principle of Least Privilege' (PoLP) entail?

options.a: Giving all users administrative access to ensure efficiency.
options.b: Restricting access to the minimum level necessary for a job function.
options.c: Allowing users to access only their own emails.
options.d: Providing access only during business hours.

question: Which tool is used for automated compliance auditing in AWS?
What is a 'Vulnerability Assessment'?

options.a: A manual attempt to hack a system.
options.b: An automated scan to identify potential weaknesses in configurations and software.
options.d: A check of physical security cameras.

question: What is the primary benefit of Continuous Monitoring?

options.a: It reduces the cost of cloud storage.
options.b: It allows for real-time detection and response to security threats.
options.c: It eliminates the need for firewalls.

question: Which of the following is a serverless compute service used for security automation in AWS?
What is Security Orchestration?

options.a: Writing a single script to check a password.
options.b: Coordinating multiple tasks or tools to work together in a security workflow.
options.d: Hiring a music orchestra for the office.

question: What is a 'Brute Force Attack'?

options.a: Physically breaking into a server room.
options.b: A trial-and-error method to guess login credentials.

question: Which Google Cloud service helps identifying risks across the environment?
What defines a 'Differential Backup'?

options.b: Accumulating changes made since the last FULL backup.
options.c: Accumulating changes made since the last INCREMENTAL backup.
options.d: Backing up the operating system only.

question: Dynamic masking is useful because:

options.b: It masks data during retrieval, ensuring authorized users can still see real data if needed.
options.d: It does not require any software.

question: Which of the following is NOT a type of Data Anonymization technique?
What is the main risk of 'Insider Threats'?

options.b: Authorized users misusing their access to steal or leak data.
options.c: Hackers breaking in from the outside.

question: In the context of Incident Response (IRP), what is 'Eradication'?

options.b: Removing the threat (e.g., deleting malicious files).

question: Which regulation grants users the 'Right to Know' how their data is used?
Under HIPAA, what does PHI stand for?
What is the purpose of 'Audit Logs' in a healthcare cloud environment?

options.a: To track exactly who accessed patient records.

question: Which organization manages the 'STAR' certification program?
What does MFA stand for in security best practices?
Why is 'On-the-fly Masking' used during ETL processes?

options.b: To mask data as it moves between systems to prevent exposure.
options.c: To delete data that is no longer needed.

question: Which of the following is a Cloud-Based Disaster Recovery solution?

options.a: Storing tapes in a bank vault.

question: What is 'Immutable Backup'?

options.a: A backup that is deleted every 24 hours.
options.b: A backup that cannot be altered or deleted by ransomware.
options.c: A backup stored on a USB drive.
options.d: A backup that changes every time a file is opened.

question: What is the role of an Intrusion Detection System (IDS)?

options.b: To detect potential cyber threats and alert administrators.

question: Which Azure tool helps manage security and configuration recommendations?
What is the definition of a 'Data Breach'?

options.a: When a hard drive fails mechanically.
options.b: When confidential information is accessed or disclosed without authorization.
options.c: When a user forgets their password.
options.d: When a cloud provider raises their prices.

question: GDPR requires data encryption in which states?

options.c: Both at rest and in transit.
options.d: Encryption is not mandatory under GDPR.

question: Under CCPA, businesses cannot deny services or charge higher prices if consumers exercise their rights. This is called:
Which ISO standard provides benchmarks for secure configurations?
What is a common target for vulnerability assessments?
Why is 'Behavioral Analytics' used in automated threat detection?

options.b: To identify unusual user actions that may indicate a threat.

question: What does an Incident Response Plan (IRP) ensure?

options.a: That the company makes a profit.
options.b: That teams efficiently address threats through structured stages.
options.c: That no one ever makes a mistake.

question: What is 'Data Generalization' in anonymization?

options.a: Replacing specific data points with broader categories (e.g., age ranges).
options.c: Copying the data to a general folder.

question: Which of the following is NOT a level of CSA STAR certification?
What is the 'Right to Data Portability' generally associated with (though not explicitly detailed in the text notes)?
If a US hospital stores patient data on a cloud server in Europe, which regulations might they need to consider?

options.d: Neither, the internet has no borders.

question: What implies that data stored in a country is subject to that country's laws?
What is the primary benefit of using a 'Token Vault'?

options.b: It allows attackers to easily guess the token.
options.c: It prevents reverse-engineering of tokens without access to the vault.

question: Which cloud automation tool is specific to Google Cloud Platform?
How does 'Automated Remediation' help in cloud security?

options.a: It automatically writes code for developers.
options.b: It responds to alerts by taking immediate corrective action (e.g., closing a port).
options.c: It sends an email to the CEO.
options.d: It shuts down the entire company.

question: What is the main difference between IDS and IPS?

options.c: IDS is hardware, IPS is software.

question: Which GDPR requirement ensures that companies report breaches quickly?
What is 'Hybrid DR'?

options.a: Using a hybrid car for transport.
options.b: A combination of on-premises and cloud storage for disaster recovery.
options.d: Backing up only half the data.

question: The 'Right to Access' under GDPR allows users to:
What is the main purpose of 'Configuration Reviews'?

options.a: To ensure employees are working hard.
options.b: To ensure cloud settings follow best practices (e.g., firewall rules).
options.c: To check the price of cloud services.
options.d: To review the color scheme of the application.

question: Which of the following is NOT a safeguard under the HIPAA Security Rule?
What does 'Data Redaction' involve?

options.b: Removing PII from documents (e.g., blocking out names).
options.d: Copying data to a USB stick.

question: Why are 'Regular Security Audits' important?

options.a: To find who is stealing office supplies.
options.b: To identify vulnerabilities before attackers can exploit them.
options.c: To increase the workload of the IT team.

question: What is the purpose of 'Log Collection'?

options.a: To gather wood for a fire.
options.b: To track user activities and access patterns for security analysis.
options.d: To keep a diary of the CEO.

question: Which component is critical for 'Real-Time Detection' of threats?
What is the 'Containment' phase in an IRP?

options.b: Limiting the scope of damage (e.g., isolating systems).

question: Which is an example of 'Confidential Business Data' that needs masking?
What does 'SaaS' stand for (implied in the ISO 27017 example)?
Which of the following describes 'Static Masking'?

options.a: Data is masked on the screen only.
options.b: Data is permanently altered before being stored in the database.
options.c: Data is masked during the backup process.

question: What is the primary reason for 'Automated Policy Enforcement'?

options.b: To ensure consistent security configurations across all environments.
options.c: To make the system look modern.

question: Which of the following is NOT a benefit of Security Automation?
What is the 'Recovery' phase in IRP?

options.b: Restoring systems and data from backups to resume operations.

question: What is 'Role-Based Access Control' (RBAC)?

options.b: Determining access based on the user's role in the organization.
options.d: Access control based on the time of day.

question: Which regulation covers the 'Right to be Forgotten'?
What is the purpose of 'Audit Logs' in HIPAA compliance?

options.b: To track exactly who accessed patient records.

question: Why is 'Data Swapping' used?

options.b: To shuffle values within a dataset to break individual associations.
options.c: To move data from HDD to SSD.
options.d: To exchange data with a competitor.

question: What is the best way to prevent 'Unauthorized Access'?

options.a: Using a sticky note for passwords.
options.c: Using the same password for everyone.

question: Which tool acts as a 'Serverless' function in AWS?
The 'Right to Delete' is a key aspect of which US law?
What is the main goal of compliance in cloud security?

options.a: To make cloud services more expensive.
options.b: To avoid legal penalties and protect customer trust.
options.d: To eliminate the need for security teams.

question: What is the 'Lessons Learned' phase of IRP?

options.a: Teaching a class about the breach.
options.b: Analyzing the incident post-mortem to improve future processes.

question: Which of the following is a 'Technical Safeguard' under HIPAA?
What is the result of 'Non-compliance' with GDPR?
What is 'Cloud Security Alliance (CSA) STAR' used for?

options.b: Evaluating cloud providers based on security and transparency.

question: GDPR applies to any organization processing EU citizen data, regardless of the organization's location. True or False?
HIPAA only applies to hospitals and doctors, not to insurance companies. True or False?
The California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) allows consumers to opt out of having their data sold. True or False?
Tokenization uses mathematical algorithms to transform data into a code. True or False?
Dynamic masking permanently changes the data stored in the database. True or False?
The 3-2-1 Backup Rule suggests keeping all three copies of data on the same server. True or False?
Security Orchestration involves coordinating multiple tools to work together. True or False?
Penetration testing is a completely automated process with no human intervention. True or False?
Data Sovereignty means data is subject to the laws of the country where it is stored. True or False?
The Capital One breach was caused by a sophisticated phishing email campaign. True or False?
Anonymized data allows organizations to use personal data for research without violating privacy laws. True or False?
AWS Lambda is a server-based computing service that requires manual OS updates. True or False?
SIEM stands for System Information and Event Management. True or False?
Under GDPR, companies have up to one month to report a data breach. True or False?
The HIPAA Security Rule includes Administrative, Physical, and Technical safeguards. True or False?
Static masking is applied to data only when it is retrieved for viewing. True or False?
A Differential Backup stores only the changes made since the last FULL backup. True or False?
ISO 27017 is a standard specifically for healthcare data security. True or False?
Continuous monitoring helps in the real-time detection of unauthorized access. True or False?
Data Residency is exactly the same concept as Data Sovereignty. True or False?
